page.title: 01WELCOME TO ST.AGNES
page.content: OUR AREA STRETCHES ALONG THE NORTH CORNISH COAST FROM THE VILLAGE OF ST.AGNES NORTHEAST TOWARDS THE TOWN OF PERRANPORTH.THE LAND IS PREDOMINANTLY RURAL GRASSLAND AND THIS COMBINED WITH ITS PROXIMITY TO THE ATLANTIC OCEAN HAS LEAD TO THE AREA BECOMING INCREASINGLY POPULAR WITH TOURISTS.THE GROUND IS RICH IN MINERALS AND WAS ONCE A HIVE OF INDUSTRIAL ACTIVITY. MANY OF THESE NOW DERELICT MINE WORKINGS CAN STILL BE SEEN, AND THESE COMBINED WITH THE RURAL NATURE OF THE AREA MAKES IT A HAVEN FOR WIDLIFE.THE {COASTAL FOOTPATH}RUNS THROUGH THE AREA ADJACENT TO AN OLD WORLD WAR 2 AIRFIELD WHICH IS NOW THE HOME OF A THRIVING GLIDER CLUB.BOTH{ST.AGNES}AND {PERRANPORTH}CATER FOR THE NEEDS OF THE RESIDENTS AND THEIR SUMMER VISITORS WHILST 9 MILES AWAY AT TRURO THERE IS A LARGE URBAN SHOPPING CENTRE.
